headline: State of the Union
subHeadline: Interview With Rep. Brendan Boyle (D-PA); Interview With Sen. J.D. Vance (R-OH); Interview With Fmr. Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY). Aired 9-10a ET

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: ... as his own warnings escalate.DONALD TRUMP, FORMER PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES (R) AND CURRENT U.S. PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE:  We have become like a garbage can.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: How would Trump use a second term? Vice presidential nominee J.D. Vance is next.And unlikely sidekick. Vice President Kamala Harris goes all in on never-Trump. KAMALA HARRIS, VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES (D) AND U.S. PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE:  He has become increasingly unhinged.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: She leans on her closer.FMR. REP. LIZ CHENEY (R-WY):  He puts people's lives at risk.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: But is that causing problems with progressives? Former Congresswoman Liz Cheney responds to Senator Vance ahead.Plus: case of change. Former first lady Michelle Obama has a message for men:

utterances.speaker: MICHELLE OBAMA, FORMER FIRST LADY
utterances.sentences: Take our lives seriously.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Can the Obamas convince the men Harris needs to win? Our panel of experts is here to discuss.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Hello. I'm Jake Tapper in Washington, where the state of our union is in the single digits, meaning it is only nine days until Election Day. And the candidates are pressing their case for every undecided orpersuadable voter out there in a race in which polls are tighter than any presidential matchup in recent memory. Vice President Kamala Harris is closing her case with a focus on Trump, much like the two Democratic candidates before her, as well as on abortion rights, with striking comments from Michelle Obama last night that we will get to in a minute. Former President Donald Trump has a darker closing argument, calling the United States of America a garbage can and belittling the intelligence of the Democratic nominee, as his campaign confronts concerns by former top Trump aides about what Trump might do in a second term. So, we went to Erie, Pennsylvania, to ask Trump running mate, Senator J.D. Vance of Ohio, about this. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Senator Vance, good to see you. Thank you so much.SEN. J.D. VANCE (R-OH), VICE PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE:  Thank you.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: So, let me ask, you.Obviously, Trump former Chief of Staff General John Kelly...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: ... was alarmed, he says, by what he heard when Trump said he wanted to use the National Guard or the Pentagon to go after the enemy within, Americans with whom he disagrees, including the Pelosis, Adam Schiff.And then he gave an interview. He said that Trump -- quote -- "certainly falls into the general definition of fascist," that he is -- quote -- "certainly an authoritarian, admires people who are dictators." You've called him a disgruntled former employee, but why shouldn't Americans out there listen to somebody who worked closely with Trump, worked with him longer than you've worked with him, retired four-star Marine general, served his country honorably, who is conservative, who says he agrees with Trump on most policies, but is worried about this aspect of Trump?

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: So, I will say two things in response.So, first of all, a lot of what John Kelly, pretty much all of what John Kelly accuses Donald Trump of saying, there were other people in the room, Mike Pence's former chief of staff, for example, who've explicitly said Donald Trump never said those things, right? So, one...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Mike Pence, a guy who is not going to support Trump because...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Mike Pence -- Mike Pence's former chief of staff said that Donald Trump didn't say those things, right? So that's number one.Number two, I actually think there's a -- there's an interesting conversation here to have, Jake, which is, why does John Kelly not support Donald Trump? It's about policy. It's not about personality.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: No, he says he agrees with Trump on most policy.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: He agrees with Trump on most policy.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: The fundamental..

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: He disagrees with Trump on how Trump views his role and his -- and the fascism and the authoritarianism.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: I don't -- I don't buy that. Jake. I don't buy that, because if you actually look at John Kelly, at folks like Liz Cheney, the fundamental disagreement they have with Donald Trump is, even though they say that they're conservative, they're conservative in the sense that they want America to get involved in a ton of ridiculous military conflicts.They want America to police the world and Donald Trump wasn't. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: John Kelly lost a son in Afghanistan. Why are you saying that -- he -- like, I've never heard John Kelly say whether he supports Iran or Afghanistan.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: His -- and I -- and I honor his son's sacrifice and I honor his family sacrifice. That doesn't mean he is not wrong about policy.Do people -- do people who have...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: But what specifically are you talking about? What has he said that...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Is your argument that a person who lost his son in Afghanistan can't be wrong about public policy?

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I'm asking you -- no.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Then why bring that up? Let's talk about public policy...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Because you were asked...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Because I've never criticized his service or his son's service.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I brought it up because you're acting as if he is pro-war, and I've never heard him say whether or not he supported the war in Afghanistan or the war in Iraq. He was a general carrying out orders.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Well, you're -- you're ascribing world views, I think, based on gut, I can't really tell where you're coming from on it. There's no evidence...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: It's based on people that I've talked to in the Trump administration.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Sure. John Bolton...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: . I'm talking about what John Kelly wanted to do, John Bolton, Liz Cheney. These people have a consistent world view.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: John Kelly was at the Department of Homeland Security. And then he was chief of staff. He was not weighing in. I don't even know what you're talking about.But let me ask you something about John Kelly specifically, because you said the other day -- quote -- "I guarantee John Kelly talked to somebody on Kamala Harris's campaign beforehand," before he did this interview. Now, I've spoken with people in John Kelly's circle and I've spoken with people in the Kamala Harris campaign. They say there's been no communication the entire time. So where did that come from?

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Oh, I'm highly skeptical of that, Jake. You know the way that these attacks work. You know the way that these people are often vetted by a campaign before something goes out there. TAPPER

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: No, I said that the American media and the American Democratic Party apparatus works a certain way. If it comes out that John Kelly never even spoke with a person in the Kamala Harris, then I'm happy...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I'm telling you that.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: You're telling me that based on secondhand conversations with John Kelly.And it's interesting. We've now spent Jake three minutes, Jake, talking about John Kelly. If it is true that he never spoke with anyone in Kamala Harris' orbit, I'm happy to apologize to John Kelly for misstating how he delivered this news to "The "Atlantic" magazine. But let's talk about who -- who did he deliver this news to? To Jeffrey Goldberg, a guy who lied the United States into the Iraq war, which led to the deaths of millions of innocent Arabs and thousands of innocent Americans. You don't go to that guy if you don't have a particular ideological motive. I think that's what's going on. If I'm wrong, I'm happy to say that I'm wrong.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I think it's interesting that you think that a magazine writer lied the American people into war.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Well, he encouraged it. He wrote stories that we're dishonest.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: He wrote a story about the gassing of the Kurds in the -- in -- I forget if it was "The Atlantic" or the "New Yorker."But I'm actually referring to John Kelly talking to "The New York Times."

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: He -- he wrote stories, by the way, where he took what intelligence officials in the American Pentagon bureaucracy said and wrote it as the gospel truth.And this highlights, the entire point that I'm making about Trump's foreign policy is, this is a guy who wants to use American troops sparingly. He wants peace through strength. It's why his foreign policy was so successful during his first term. It's all the same people who were wrong about Iraq. They were wrong about the quagmire in Afghanistan. They were wrong about Syria. They were wrong about everything. And now they're coming after Donald Trump, because he actually has a realistic and cautious foreign policy.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about people who worked for Donald Trump in his first administration.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Sure. TAPPERJohn Kelly, but Mark Milley, who was the Trump-appointed chairman of his Joint -- of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Who disobeyed Trump's direct orders on troop deployments in Syria.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about the guy that -- that had your job.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: A massive, a massive, massive violation of his constitutional oath, by the way.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about the guy that had your job before Donald Trump's supportive crowd wanted to hang him, Vice President Mike Pence, who said, as you know, that Trump put himself before the Constitution.I'm talking about General Mattis, also secretary of defense in Trump's administration. I'm talking about Mark Esper, the secretary of defense, who told me that Trump does have fascistic tendencies, John Bolton, H.R. McMaster, Alyssa Farah Griffin.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Every single one -- OK, OK, Jake -- are you going to listen to every...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: These are Trump administration officials.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: ... Trump administration official?Do you know one reason why Kamala Harris doesn't have as many people criticizing her, is because she doesn't fire people who fail. That's why we haven't had a real audit of the disastrous Afghanistan withdrawal is because Kamala Harris protects failures in government. Donald Trump fires them. And I would much rather have the president who fires people who screw up. Now, Jake, no, no, no, this is an important point.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: He did not fire Mike Pence. He did not fire Mike Pence. He did not fire Mark Milley.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Kamala Harris is the present....(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: He did not fire General -- I mean John...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: He fired a lot of those people, Jake. And he did because they weren't doing their job. But this is the thing, Jake. We've -- we've now spent...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: ... five minutes talking about people and Donald Trump's staff...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Who think he's not fit for office.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: ... who he fired, who he fired.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Who think he's not fit for office.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Oh, they didn't think he was unfit for office until they had a falling out with him because he fired them. And we're not talking about the public policy.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Can we talk about how Americans can't afford groceries, Jake.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: We're actually -- we're actually talking about...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Can we talk about the fact that Americans can't afford the cost of housing?

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: We're actually talking about...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Can we talk about the fact that a lot of people out there in Erie, Pennsylvania, they're the ones who suffer and die when people like Mark Esper and Mark Milley don't obey the commander in chief's orders.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: We're talking about Donald Trump and what he says.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Yes.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Donald Trump says...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: And you'd much rather talk about what Donald Trump allegedly said...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about he's said publicly.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: ... than what Donald Trump did in office, Jake. What he did in office is...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: What he said publicly, he wants to use the military to go after the enemy within, which is the American people...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: He did not say that, Jake.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: The enemy within.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: He said that he was going to send the military after the American people? Show me the quote where he said the .

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: He said the American -- the enemy within.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: He said far left lunatics. He's talking about...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Like the Pelosis and Schiff.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: ... people rioting.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: He's talking about people rioting after the election. I think...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: The Pelosis were rioting after the election?

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: He said...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Adam Schiff was rioting after the election?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: You're using two separate phrases. He said about using the military that far left lunatics, people who riot in the wake of an election.People who burned down American cities in the summer of 2020, yes, we should have a federal law enforcement response.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: This is what he said to Joe Rogan on Friday. The enemy within that he wants the military to go after...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: No, he -- no, this is the thing.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: ... the second part.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: The enemy within...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: ... problem like Kim Jong-un, we have to -- we have people that are really bad people that I really think want to make this country unsuccessful. That's who the enemy within... (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: And did he say that he wants to use the military against those people here? Here's the game.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: He said he wants to use the military to go after the enemy within.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: There's the game that you're playing. He said...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I'm not playing a game.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, let me -- can I answer the question, please? He said that he wanted to use the military to go after far left lunatics who were rioting. And he also called them -- he also called them the enemy within.He separately, in a totally different context and a totally different context in a totally conversation, said that Nancy Pelosi and Adam Schiff were threats to this country. He never said...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Were the enemy within, were the enemy within. He said they were the enemy within.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: So, every time he uses the exact same phrase, we assume that he used...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I don't go around the term of enemy within to talk about using the military against going -- American people.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Well, you're a journalist. And you're asking his vice president, but you won't let me answer the question.I'm telling you that Donald Trump has said, and I agree with him, that we should use the U.S. military to...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: To go after Americans?

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: ... go after people who riot, who burned down our cities. We should call in the National Guard.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: And this is what John Kelly -- this is what John Kelly was alarmed by, the idea of using the U.S. military to go after Americans.That's what he said.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: He's not -- Donald Trump never said Americans, writ large. You keep on putting words in his mouth.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Are they -- or are they not Americans? VANCE(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Now you're doing a very narrow definition of what he said, which is not what he said.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: I don't care.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: That's not what he said.But let me ask you the bigger question.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: He did. No, no, he did say that, Jake. He did. He said that he wanted to use the U.S. military -- let me clarify.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: To go after the far-left lunatics, yes. And then he also added...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: ... people who were rioting and looting.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: And then he added -- and added -- he added Schiff and then he added the Pelosis. And then he added people that don't want the country to succeed.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: He said that Adam Schiff and Nancy Pelosi, he used in a separate context in a separate conversation. And what you're doing is you're smashing two totally different conversations...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: FOX asked him about this last week, and he didn't take issue with it. He said the enemy within is the biggest -- is the biggest threat to this country.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: But did he say the enemy within, that he's going to use the military against Nancy Pelosi? Donald Trump offered Nancy Pelosi the National Guard on January 6, and according to private e-mails, she rejected it.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Oh, boy.So, let's -- let's talk about things that he wants to do that are feeding into this concern that people like John Kelly and General Mattis and General Milley have. He said on Friday, special counsel Jack Smith should get thrown out of the country. He's threatened to arrest election officials who cheated. We know that he believes a lot of people cheated that did not cheat. He wants to...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: If you violate the law, you should be arrested, yes.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: No one disagrees with that. But he's talking about...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Apparently, you do, based on the way you're asking the question.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not -- no, based on the fact that he's accused people that didn't break the law of breaking the law when it comes to the election.And if you want to revisit that, I'm happy to. But Liz Cheney, he said, should be put before a war tribunal. None of that sounds fascist to you at all?

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: No, of course it doesn't.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Putting Liz Cheney before a military tribunal?

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: First of all, I don't buy into the premise of what you're saying, Jake.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: These are things he said. These are things he said.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Because I just -- on things that I know that he said -- on things that I know that he said, you're impugning things. You're taking words out of context. You're taking two separate conversations and pretending that they...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: ... were made at the exact same time.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: So I'm rejecting the premise of your question. I frankly don't believe what you're saying about Donald Trump's words.If you'd like to put up a clip and actually put him in context, I think the American people would realize that Donald Trump is a hell of a lot more reasonable than the people like Liz Cheney, who would like to lie us into war. Now, Jake, we also should remember, I mean, step back a little bit. Well, ask yourself a basic question about network integrity. You guys talked about the Russia hoax nonstop. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: The FBI was investigating it. The FBI was investigating it. So, we -- so we covered them.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: And so you took the words of unnamed FBI agents and put them on your network as if they we're the gospel truth. You did it again and again. [09A viewer of your network would've believed that Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin conspired in 2016. Now that was totally and preposterously false.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: No. No. What you just said is false.We covered an FBI investigation. I don't know why you want to talk about the FBI investigation.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: You covered it in a way that gave credence to anonymous sources, accusations. You did it yourself. Your network did it, Jake.But, again, can we talk about the issues that Americans care about?

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about things that Donald Trump has said.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Yes. And Kamala Harris...

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: If you have an issue whether or not he's talking about the economy enough, that's between you and your running mate. I'm talking about things he has said this week.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Every single rally that he does, he talks about how he wants to unleash American energy so we can lower the cost of groceries. He talks about the fact that housing has become unaffordable. He talks about the wide-open border, Jake.Kamala Harris and her allies -- you know, it's interesting. Kamala Harris and our media allies -- and I would put CNN in this category -- you guys -- you guys seem to... (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: They wouldn't. I will tell you that. They wouldn't.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Well, they should watch your network more, because you guys seem to care more about Donald Trump's past than the future of the American people. We're running this campaign on making of the American dream affordable.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I'm specifically asking about how Donald Trump is going to be president in the future should he win.And we're being told we have more...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: He's going to pursue economic policies that lower the cost of groceries and make life more affordable again. He talks about it every single day on the campaign trail. And so do I.What you're talking about is an anonymously sourced story or one guy who... (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Nothing anonymously sourced, zero...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Or who -- one guy who is a disgruntled employee.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I told you 10 people.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Five other people push back against him and said that what he said was dishonest.So why don't we talk about the policy that's affecting American citizens and not what Donald Trump allegedly said, according to one guy who's pissed off because he got fired by Donald Trump?

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I didn't bring up any of the things that he said. He said -- I didn't bring up...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: You brought up John Kelly. And that...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I brought up John Kelly's view of Donald Trump. I didn't bring up John Kelly talking about what Donald Trump said about Hitler's generals. I didn't bring that up. I talked about John Kelly's view of Trump based on something Trump has been saying in the last week.So that's what I asked about.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: So, John Kelly makes accusations that are rejected by five people. You -- you...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Again, you're talking about something I didn't bring that up.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: I think that maybe implicates his overall judgment. And I think the fact that he has a world view that's so oppositional to peace and prosperity suggests that he's not an honest arbiter here.This is not a guy, John Kelly, going to brag to Jeffrey Goldberg who is interested in the American truth or is interested in telling an honest account of Donald Trump. He's a guy with an axe to grind because Donald Trump fired him and disagreed with him on policy.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: So, all those 10 people, including the former Vice President Mike Pence, all of these people are -- have this horribly damaged world view, and they're all just going after Donald Trump because they want to send people into war?That's what -- that's really your argument?

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: It's not like these are conservative...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. Absolutely, that's my argument. Jake, all of these people...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: These aren't conservative Republicans who are concerned about Donald Trump? They're not? That's not right?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: All of the people, Jake, they came into office thinking that they could control Donald Trump, that when he said he wanted peace in the world...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Mike Pence thought he could control Donald Trump?

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Yes, he did.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: And when he found out that he couldn't, they all turned on Donald Trump. And a lot of them got fired. And we are running and we're trying to staff the government with people who are going to govern according to principles of peace and prosperity.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Let me ask you...

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: They're pissed off about it.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Let me ask you, because we're being told that we're over.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Yes.One more question, because we have to go to this rally.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.You are running to be vice president of the United States.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: And there is a 50/50 chance, maybe better, I don't know, that you're going to succeed. Are you running to be vice president of the United States or are you running to be vice president of the red states?Because if you win, and there's a decent chance you will, you're going to be vice president of childless cat ladies. You're going to be vice president of legal Haitian -- Haitian migrants in Springfield, Ohio. You're going to be their vice president too. Are you running to do that?

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Jake, of course, I'm running to be the vice president of all Americans. I'm running because I want people to be able to afford a good life in this country.You know how I grew up. You know that I grew up in a family where things were often tough. I want, whether you're in a blue state or a red state, whether you're going to vote for Trump or you're going to vote for Harris, I want you to be able to have a good life in this country. But that's not going to happen with the broken leadership in Washington, D.C. Let me give you a statistic, Jake, because here is what the leadership of people like Kamala Harris and Nancy Pelosi and, yes, Mike Pence, over 30 years in this country has led to. A person with a bachelor's degree lives seven years longer than a person without a bachelor's degree. There are a lot of people who have gotten rich and powerful off -- off of American decline. Some of them have had R's next to their name. Some of them have had D's next to their name. And the first person who I believe is really putting the interest of the American people first is Donald J. Trump. So, yes, we're going to be the president and the vice president for all people. The only way to do that is to reject the failed consensus.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Jake.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Thank you so much, Senator. Appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: VANCE
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Have a good time out there.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: She is the closer for Vice President Kamala Harris.Former Republican Congresswoman Liz Cheney joins me live to talk about the campaign and respond to Senator Vance after this quick break. (COMMERCIAL BREAK) TAPPER:  We will be right back to STATE OF THE UNION. Over the past month, Vice President Kamala Harris has appeared alongside one political surrogate perhaps, perhaps more than any other, conservative former Republican lawmaker former Congresswoman Liz Cheney of Wyoming, who joins us now. Congresswoman, thank you so much for joining us. We have a lot to get to. But, first, I just want to give you a chance to respond to what you heard from Senator Vance, since he invoked vote you so many times, even though I never mentioned your name once.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: And his argument, as you heard there, was that all of the Trump administration officials that I mentioned from Vice President Pence to General Milley to General Mattis to General McMaster to Alyssa Farah Griffin to, I mean, on and on and on, that every one of them opposes Trump because they want to involve the United States into foreign wars.And that was that was where he like -- and he said, "Absolutely," when I said, is that really what you're saying? Is that really your argument? CHENEY:  Yes.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: And what did what did you make of that?

utterances.speaker: CHENEY
utterances.sentences: I mean, look, the reality of the situation that we're facing is that people that have long been focused on national security issues, people that look to Ronald Reagan as a guide and as an example, we understand that the way that you avoid war is, in fact, peace through strength.And when look at something like what J.D. Vance and Donald Trump want to do in terms of forcing Ukraine to surrender, J.D. Vance says that he's really agnostic as between Russia and Ukraine. Forcing Ukraine to surrender in the aftermath of the kind of brutality that we have seen from Putin, suggesting that America doesn't favor Ukraine over Russia, demonstrates just a total lack of understanding of the importance of our allies in keeping the peace. Donald Trump, every chance he gets, he attacks our allies. He talks about our allies as though he were a mafia boss. He seems to completely fail to understand that, in order to keep peace, we have to have allies with us. We also have to be strong. And Putin obviously now is allied with Iran. He's allied with North Korea, allied with China. And so J.D. Vance and Donald Trump think that the right solution there is to go in and reward Putin for what he's done, reward all of his adversaries for what they have done, rather than stand with our allies. So I think what you saw is a mix of desperation and naivete and just a really an attempt to do the best I think he can figure out how to do to convince the American people not to believe what they know to be true about Donald Trump. And I think his desperation is clearly showing.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: So it's not just Vance. Obviously, Donald Trump has been trying to use your support for Vice President Harris as a way to divide would-be supporters of Harris, especially -- just the other day, he talked about -- well, I will just scroll the clip.There are a lot of voters out there obviously on the left, on the progressive left, Arab Americans, Muslim Americans, who don't like Biden/Harris administration's support for Israel in the war in Gaza, and Trump trying to exploit your support for Harris. Take a listen. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Kamala Harris is campaigning with Muslim-hating warmonger Liz Cheney, who wants to invade practically every Muslim country on the planet.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: And let me tell you, the Muslims of our country, they see it and they know it.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: CHENEY
utterances.sentences: Yes-, again, I think that they don't -- the Trump campaign, Donald Trump, they have no way to respond substantively to the truth, to the facts that Vice President Harris has built a coalition that is unlike any other we have ever seen, frankly, certainly in modern American history, maybe in American history writ large.And that is a coalition that includes people from the far left of the political spectrum to people on the far right of the political spectrum, including many people who used to work for Donald Trump. And the reason that we have all come together is not necessarily because we said we agree on every issue. We don't, certainly. But we understand fundamentally that the defense of the rule of law, the defense of our Constitution, those are the things that are that are at stake in this election. And Donald Trump doesn't have any way to explain this broad, again, unprecedented support that the Vice President Harris is receiving. And I would also say I am absolutely confident, having spent time with Vice President Harris, having talked to her, she really does believe and understands how important it is for her to govern as a president who unites us, as a president who listens to different perspectives and points of view, as a president who's going to do what's right for this country. And I hope that you guys play as much Donald Trump footage as you can over the course of the next nine days or so, because the more the American people see him, the more they remember we cannot have a president who is unstable and depraved and cruel. And that's what Donald Trump proves himself to be every time he yet he says things like that.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: You mentioned how you don't -- you certainly don't agree with Kamala Harris on every issue or even most issues in terms of the traditional political debates of domestic politics.Let's talk about abortion, which is a big issue in this race. You are against abortion. You're pro-life you supported Roe v. Wade being overturned in 2022. Last week, at an event with Kamala Harris, you said you were deeply troubled by what you have watched happen in many Republican-led states since the Dobbs decision in terms of the bans that the legislatures have put into place. Can you explain your view on this further? CHENEY:  Yes. And what I would say is, I'm not the only one who holds this view, but I think that -- and I certainly have talked to many of them -- you have pro-life women all across this country who have been watching what's happened in places like Texas, in places like North Carolina, where, since Roe was overturned, you have had laws put in place at the state level that are preventing women from getting lifesaving care. You have circumstances where women are faced with whatever sorts of emergency care it might be, whether it's miscarriages and they require treatment, that aren't able to get that treatment, where you have doctors unsure of whether or not the kind of care that the woman needs may in fact be something that's been criminalized by state law. And that's not acceptable. And I think that's where you have women who, like me, have been pro-life who are saying, no, this -- what we have seen happen cannot stand. When you have the attorney general of the state of Texas suing to get access to the medical records of women who have sought abortions, but Donald Trump won't give us access to his own medical records, I mean, this is a -- we have crossed over into a situation that is bringing women together, uniting women who are pro-choice and pro-life behind Vice President Harris, in defense of making sure that women have health care, lifesaving health care, care that they need so that they don't find themselves in a situation where either their own life is at risk, where they can't have babies in the future. This is just simply -- simply unsustainable.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Former Republican Congresswoman Liz Cheney, thanks so much for joining us. Really appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: ... that, when we're talking about women's rights, yes, it's a women's issue, but it's not just a women's issue.It affects the men that are in women's lives. So I do think that, every election -- in fact, I don't just think this. It is a fact that, ever since June 2022, Democrats have consistently outperformed what the polling was in those elections, whether it was the special in Alaska, or Upstate New York, where we won two very difficult congressional races, that November, where Democrats historically overperformed a midterm election. Now, this presidential will be the first test of it in a larger voter universe.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes, on a national level.

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: But I have to say, I feel very confident.And I remember hearing November 2022, some months after Dobbs, five months, someone said to me, oh, surely, by now, women will have forgotten the Dobbs decision. Women did not forget the Dobbs decision.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: What do you think about the issue and about first lady Obama's message?

utterances.speaker: KRISTEN SOLTIS ANDERSON, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: I think the issue is one where it definitely puts Republicans in more of a political challenge, because Democrats are very unified on it, Republicans are not.So if I was the Trump campaign, for them to close on a message that includes a lot of focus on abortion would be a concerning strategic choice. It's the right choice for them. It would concern me as the Trump campaign. But I think telling male voters that you don't care about this issue enough and you're wrong and bad if you don't, I do worry, is not -- I think that that's just not a good way to deliver a message. I think telling someone you're going to scold them for not agreeing with you is never as good as a different tack to invite them to agree with you.

utterances.speaker: KAREN FINNEY, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's -- I actually heard something different from the former first lady, which is to say, you have stakes in this issue as well. It is the women in your lives who will also suffer in ways that, as we have seen, even if you just say take it back to the states, we saw a woman die in Georgia.We have seen -- at that same event, you heard from men and women who have suffered grave consequences around the issue. And, interestingly enough, not long after the overturning of Dobbs -- the Dobbs decision, young black and brown men were also expressing concerns, saying, well, if they can take that right away, what other rights can they take away? And I think it's important to remind people of that.

utterances.speaker: SCOTT JENNINGS, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: I take the Obamas' message all in, his and hers, when he went out the other day and told African-American men that, if they didn't vote for Kamala Harris, it was because they just didn't like the idea of having a woman president.I think this browbeating, I think this scolding, this idea that if you don't vote Democrat, then you can't control your own rage, I don't know anybody that feels rageful. I do know working-class men who feel like they have been beaten down in this economy. I think there has been a lot of scolding and browbeating on this front. I think these never-Trump people are scolding and browbeating Republicans who decide they'd rather have a center-right government. And I just think when you're closing on that sort of hateful message, it means you're worried.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: There's a new poll out today from ABC News/Ipsos, which has Harris leading by four points among likely voters. This is nationally. It's up by two among registered voters.The CNN poll of polls determines no clear leader. The new polling did find Harris regaining strength with Hispanics, remaining strong with African-Americans, and widening her advantage amongst suburban women. But let me turn to somebody who was an expert on one of the most, if not the most important battleground, which is the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. Last I heard from my sources up in Pennsylvania, it remains neck-and-neck. It remains tied. What's your understanding? You represent, what, half Philadelphia and half Chester County? What's -- what's the other county?

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, I'm entirely within Philadelphia, yes. TAPPERin Philly? And what about those suburbs?

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, so, look -- and I felt the same way a month ago after the debate, when a number of my fellow Democrats were, as Greenspan might say, irrationally exuberant. I said it was a 50-50 race.Now some of my Republican friends are also rationally exuberant, and I tell them it's a 50-50 race. This will come down to a few tenths of a percentage point. It was a one-point race in 2016 in Pennsylvania and it was half-a-percentage point in 2020. That's the way it is now. I was out campaigning all throughout my district from Independence Hall and the Liberty Bell all the way up to the far Northeast. And I can tell you that I am pleasantly surprised how much enthusiasm there is for the Democratic ticket. When I say pleasantly surprised, all the indications were over the summer, even as late as August, that we were headed toward a lower turnout than what we saw in 2020. That's no longer operable. I think we will actually exceed the 159 million that we hit nationwide in 2020.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: New this morning, we have now crossed 40 million ballots cast so far across the country with nine days to go, 40 million. Those are actual votes. Forget the polls. Those are actual votes.My panel's here. We have nine days left. What do you either want to see your side do or what are you going to be looking for in the next nine days?

utterances.speaker: FINNEY
utterances.sentences: And I have talked to Republicans who are sure they're not going to vote for Trump, but interested in voting for Harris. So I want her to continue -- and I think I would rather be us thanthem, because the potential voters, the universe is bigger. You can see that in her schedule today. She's doing Souls to the Polls. She's doing a general event. Then she's going to talk to black men, Latino men, and then several more events. I want her to keep talking to as many voters as possible, not necessarily in interviews, but going out where they are, meeting them where they are and having the conversations.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: What are you looking for?

utterances.speaker: SOLTIS ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: So I will piggyback off of Scott's to say -- I know this probably won't happen, but wouldn't it be great to take this dark campaign and end it on a positive note?Donald Trump has the opportunity to go out there and at the last minute say, don't you remember what the economy was like under me? The Middle East wasn't on fire. Ukraine hadn't been invaded. He has things he can say to tap into that nostalgia that a lot of voters still kind of feel for him, even if they don't love him personally. If he could make that positive turn at the end, I think voters who are on the fence about voting at all, that's what they would need to hear.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Congressman?

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: Every election is about the future, not the past, so Kamala Harris talking about how she will bring costs down, how, with Donald Trump, things will get worse, not better, and to vote for the Democratic ticket if we care about middle-class economics.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: OK, go, birds, to you. That's a partisanship I have right here.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Pro-Eagles.

utterances.speaker: BOYLE
utterances.sentences: Fly, Eagles, fly.(LAUGHTER)
